sentences.sContent: He will be hard to beat. I fully expect (= am completely sure about ) that and I’m ready.
sentences.sCn: 他很难击败。我确信这一点，不过我准备好了。

sentences.sContent: ‘Who are you?’ he murmured, only half expecting (= thinking it was possible, but not likely ) her to answer.
sentences.sCn: “你是谁？”他低声问道，预计她可能不会回答。

sentences.sContent: to expect a visit/call/letter from sb
sentences.sCn: 等待某人的来访 / 电话 / 来信

sentences.sContent: ...you wouldn’t expect to turn up and just be able to run it...
...And we expect this will have a huge impact on obesity...
...Many fast-food companies now expect to increase their revenue by introducing higher-priced items...
...Analysts expect the fast-food industry to grow modestly this year...
...but I wouldn't expect them to save to buy their own socks...
...What it means is that people are often treated the way they expect to be treated...
...what would lie expect them to do with their pocket money...
...And what would you expect them to do with it...
...Just imagine! We have to finish reading 300 pages before Monday! How can the professor expect us to do it in such a short time...
...And then state your problem and what you expect to have done about it...

words.tran: 期待的；怀孕的；预期中的

trans.tranOther: to think that something will happen because it seems likely or has been planned
